snippet: Seed-catalog hyperbole, endangered artifacts competing for attention, and Egypt-inspired vintage jewelry.
abstract: Eve M Kahn Antiques column; Bartow-Pell Mansion Museum in the Bronx is displaying planting how-tos and garden philosophy books from its library; advocacy groups in Oklahoma, Virginia and Pennsylvania are asking the public to help devise Top 10 lists of deteriorating antiques in institutional hands; exhibit of Egypt-inspired vintage jewelry is on sale at S J Shrubsole gallery in Manhattan.
lead_paragraph: Seed-catalog hyperbole, endangered artifacts competing for attention, and Egypt-inspired vintage jewelry.

headline.main: Hydrangea Hyperbole at New York Botanical Garden
headline.print_headline:
Ladies, Beware:
Tall Tales About Violets
